intro: Palaua declinata, commonly known as the drooping palaua, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its drooping inflorescences and palmate leaves. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Palaua declinata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
